comments.body: Maybe for now we should move this test to `tests-ext` to lower chance of interference between tests?

Wojciech,  thank you for the review.

I can move the tests to wherever you direct, but I think the current location
is the proper place for two reasons:

1) The Test as-is, as explained in the comment, does not exercise the
     potentially problematic methods.  It should be as safe as any other
     Test currently in the `unit-tests` project.  

     Being in the same place as the other posixlib tests makes it 
     easy to find.   Granted that is a concern only after the Test is
     shown to be and is considered safe.

     The two problematic methods _could_ be tested  using a 
      `scripted` test.  The time/benefit ratio of requiring such a test,
      is not advantageous, especially when there has been discussion
      about removing/limiting `scripted` tests.  

2)  From reverse engineering the contents of `tests-ext`, it looks like
     the purpose of that project is to support parts of Scala Native
     outside the core.  `posixlib sys/resource.scala` should be part of
     the core of Scala Native, at least until some OS dependent spinoffs
     are designed and implemented.  

Please advise.
